title: Pehlu Khan (55) and others
victim_action: were legally transporting two milch cows to Haryana in a pickup truck.
victim_names: Pehlu Khan (55), Azmat (22), Irshad, Aarif and Rafiq
accused_action: saw the victims's pick-up truck on the highway and assumed that they were transporting the bovines illegally.
the_lynching: The Gau Rakshaks intercepted the pick-up and proceeded to beat up the men. Pehlu Khan succumbs to injuries.

title: Mohammad Majloom (35) and others
victim_action: were legally walking with the cattle at night.
accused_names: Mithilesh Prasad Sahu, Pramod Kumar Sahu, Manoj Kumar Sahu, Manoj Sahu
accused_action: wanted to steal the victim's cows.
the_lynching: The villagers beat up the victims with sticks, strangled them and hanged their bodies on trees and finally hid their cows in the forest.

title: Mohammad Akhlaq (52) and others
accused_action: heard a rumour that a cow had been slaughtered and beef was stored in Akhlaq's house.
the_lynching: A mob of 200 stormed the house and beat up Akhlaq and son. Akhlaq died.

title: Anaf and and others
accused_action: discovered the theft at 4am and started following the theives. At 6am they intercepted the theives.
the_lynching: The suspected thieves opened fire. While two of the five suspected thieves fled, three were allegedly beaten to death by the angry mob.
which_law: Alleged cattle theft / smuggling. An FIR had been lodged by the villagers against the alleged smugglers  under sections 382 (theft), 457 (trespass) and 307 (attempt to murder)  of the IPC.

title: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and others
victim_action: were driving a truck loaded with coal to Srinagar.
victim_names: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and Showkat Ahmed (35)
accused_action: had stopped traffic in view of the strike following recovery of three carcasses in the district.
the_lynching: A mob of 9 people threw a petrol bomb on Zahid's coal-laden truck. Zahid suffered 60% burn injuries and later succembed.

title: Noman (20) and others
victim_action: were rashly driving a truck with cattle. The truck failed to negotiate a sharp turn and crashed.
accused_action: suspected that the cattle were being taken to Uttar Pradesh for slaughter.
the_lynching: The villagers secured the cattle, caught the people travelling in the truck and beat them up. The villagers handed four of them to the police. Police found a critically-injured Noman by the mountainside the next day. He was taken to a local hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries.
which_law: Alleged cattle theft / smuggling. While Noman died, the other four were booked under Section 11 of the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, Section 8 of the Himachal Pradesh Cow Slaughter Act and Section 429 of the IPC.

title: Nazakat Ali (45) and others
victim_action: were legally moving with their cattle on foot from the plains to highland pastures.
victim_names: Nazakat Ali (45), Naseema (40), Sabar Ali (60), Abida Bibi (22) and Saina (8)
accused_tag: Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Bajrang Dal activists

title: Mohammed Hussain (43) and others
victim_action: traveling in the general compartment of the Kushinagar Express.
accused_action: acted on a tip-off about beef being transported by some passengers. They started searching the luggage of all passengers in the compartment.
the_lynching: This led to a scuffle. A black bag was found with suspected beef, which later turned out to be buffalo meat after laboratory tests. The owners of that bag were not found.
which_law:
The victims had not committed any crime. However, a black bag was found during the episode with buffalo meat. The police registered a case under Section 429 (mischief by killing or maiming 
cattle.) of the IPC against two unknown persons to whom the bag  belonged.

title: Unknown
victim_action: were illegally carrying 30 kgs meat at Mandsaur railway station.
accused_action: suspected that they were carrying beef.
the_lynching: The gau rakshaks beat up the women. The meat later turned out to be buffalo meat. Both the women have been taken into custody for ‘smuggling and trying to sell’ the meat.
which_law: While the article mentions that the two women were guilty because carrying buffalo meat in MP without permission is illegal it does not specify under which law. Another article from the Indian Express [ http://indianexpress.com/article/india/india-news-india/beef-madhya-pradesh-video-cow-vigilantes-gau-rakshaks-2938751/ ] says that the two women were not guilty

title: Mota Samadhiyala (46) and others
victim_names: Balu Sarvaiya (46), Vashram (26), Kunvarben, Ramesh (23), Bechar Sarvaiya (30), Ashok Sarvaiya (20) and Deveshi Babariya (32).
accused_names: Pramodigiri Goswami, Balvant Balvant Dhiru, Rasik, Ramesh Jadav, Rakesh Joshi and Nagji Ahir
accused_action: suspected that they had slaughtered the cow.
the_lynching: Gau rakshaks started abusing the victims and attacked them with iron pipes, sticks and a knife with which the victims were removing the skin of the carcass. After beating them up, the attackers reportedly took Vashram, Ramesh, Ashok and Bechar to Una town. There, they paraded the four victims, and flogged them publicly all the way to the police station.

title: Rizwan and others
victim_action: were illegally transporting 300 kg of beef.
accused_action: got a tip-off. They chased the victim's car for 7 kms before they finally managed to stop them.
the_lynching: They forced the victims to eat a concoction of cow dung, cow urine, milk, curd and ghee. The gau rakshaks later turned over the two men to Faridabad police.
which_law:
Were carrying beef which is a crime under Section 8 of the The Haryana Gauvansh Sanrakshan And Gausamvardhan Act, 2015 (http://nyaaya.in/law/1028/the-haryana-gauvansh-sanrakshan-and-gausamvardhan-act-2015/ )

8. Prohibition of sale of beef.-  Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, no person shall directly or indirectly sell, keep, store, transport or offer for sale or cause to be sold beef or beef products except for such medicinal purposes and in such form as may be prescribed.

title: Unknown

accused_action: spotted the blood at the dairy.
the_lynching: They broke into the diary and beat up the men.
which_law: Alleged slaughtering of a buffalo - were arrested under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act

title: Mustain Abbas (27)
victim_action: were legally transporting two buffalos that they had bought.
accused_action: had blocked the road with tractors and were checking vehicles for cows.
the_lynching: The victims tried to turn their pick-up truck around but thorns on the road punctured their tyre. The gau rakshaks started firing. The 5 victims jumped out of the car and ran. The gau rakshaks caught Mustain, beat, stabbed and strangled him to death. Mustain's body was found a month later in a drain.

accused_action: received a tip off and raiding their house and beat up the men before notifying the police.

which_law: Abduction and Gang-Rape of a minor girl. This TOI report suggests that he had a criminal record with 15 criminal cases including murder and extortion.   http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bhopal/Gang-rape-accused-lynched-by-furious-mob/articleshow/21554901.cms

victim_action: trying to escape following a failed attempt of vehicle theft.

the_lynching: Villagers lynched one of them. The other opened fire in self-defence and killed one villager Ismail Mia and injured nine other.

was tortured by villagers after a local priest “identified” her as a witch who had allegedly spread diseases and misfortune among the local people.
While a group of men tied Bora with a fishing net, video clippings taken by some persons on the mobile phone showed the priest, one Biswa Medhi, sitting on the woman and beating her up.

the_lynching: Rumours of cow slaughter triggered violence with protesters targeting police vehicles and setting afire shops, leaving seven policemen injured. The post-mortem report found that the cow had died due to an ailment

the_lynching: The victim was getting ready to transport four calves in a minivan to neighbouring Shimoga district as part of a contract with a cattle dealer. Nearly 30 people, led by local HJV leader Arvind Sherigar, surrounded the minivan and attacked Poojary and Devadiga with iron rods.

the_lynching: Suffered serious injury on his left eye after he was beaten up for scaring a group of cattle by honking in a bid to move them off the middle of the road

The police had to resort to firing in the air to control the agitated crowd.Police said some local residents spotted three trucks carrying meat were crossing the Palwal-Aligarh road. While two of the trucks managed to pass the area, the third was stopped.

They also tried to set the truck on fire but police reached the spot and prevented them. Actions were also taken against seven policemen who did not take the matter seriously and reached late at the scene

The villagers went to Bijupara in Ranchi district the next day and consulted an oracle, who gave them descriptions that matched with the victims. The oracle claimed that the two were involved in witchcraft which led to the deaths. Before the villagers could kill the Oraons, Parshuram got a whiff and slipped out of the village and approached the police.

title: Two women
the_lynching: Two Muslim women were reportedly beaten up by members of cow vigilante groups over suspicion that they were carrying beef. The women were reportedly caught carrying 30 kg of meat after which police was informed.
which_law: Importing of buffalo meat inside Madhya Pradesh without permission is illegal and thus both of them have been taken into custody for ‘smuggling and trying to sell’ the meat.

title: Das, Phagunu Bhatra, Gurubaru Bhatra
victim_action: was involved in a land dispute.
the_lynching: Das was lynched by Bhatra tribals, moments after Das stabbed tribal Phagunu Bhatra to death and critically injured Gurubaru Bhatra of the same village.

title: Woman (45), man
victim_action: went to file a police complaint againt 4 locals who haressed their daughter.
the_lynching: A couple who had accused four persons of harassing their daughter were attacked in Polasara block of Ganjam district. The woman was beaten to death while her husband managed to escape.
